name: Fireside Motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife booked a room at the Fireside after reading all the glowing reviews here on trip advisor but our experience was the worst of our trip. We were travelling the Oregon coast and found the scenery to be stunning. The location of this motel is right on the coast with waves crashing on the rocks sending dramatic plumes of spray into the air. However, our room obviously had a serious mold problem, the smell blasted you as soon as we opened the door. I mentioned it to the front desk staff and they sent someone with an ozone air purifier but it had little effect so they moved us to another room. The new room was marginally better (see photos), we had to sleep with the windows open all night. It is a serious health risk to let people stay in such poor conditions. Lets face it, the location is so close to ocean, the humidity is high, there is vinyl siding, the rooms are probably not heated properly in the off season, this is the perfect breeding ground for mold in the walls and attic. Now, both rooms were in an older part of the motel complex so I hope they plan to redevelop, there is a new development next door by same owners. I suspect the other reviews listed are for the newer buildings (however, these rooms are more than twice the price). The wing we stayed in should be condemned by the health department. The cleaning and maintenance staff have the toughest jobs here, trying to stay on top of an old building with serious moisture problems. I Will Not Stay Here Again!
reviews.title: Do Not Stay Here - Mold and Rust

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: My daughter and I stayed in the apt. with the ocean view (after camping in the rain for two nights). It was amazingly spacious! We were delighted to have so much room to spread out our gear, and dry out. The apt. was very clean. The kitchen was well equipped. The ocean view was delightful. In addition, we truly appreciated the opportunity for mid-afternoon check-out. This allowed us to go for a trail run, have lunch, and then shower before heading out to our next destination (Portland, OR).
reviews.title: Perfect for Our Needs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second consecutive Memorial Day getaway in Yachats at the Fireside. We decided that we had such a good time last year, why take the time to search for a new spot, just go back to the Fireside. No regrets.
reviews.title: Another Great Weekend Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013
reviews.text: The Fireside gives you true ocean front with the Pacific crashing on the rocks less about 100 feet from your room. It is hard to find a place on the Oregon coast where you are as close to the surf. We also really like the ledgy rocky coastline of Yachats which is very different from the typical beach and headlands found most everywhere else.
reviews.title: Amazing views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unlike last year, we were on the second floor in a queen fireplace room. Much better than first floor, we both liked being higher up for better views. The gas fireplace was also a nice addition.
reviews.title: Our Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013
reviews.text: Really liked our oceanfront room with fireplace, wonderful view of Pacific Ocean. Friendly staff, two sinks in bathroom area, neat little screened windows open to get ocean breezes. Comfy beds, pastry breakfast you get from front desk and take to room.
reviews.title: Charming place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cannot stress enough how wonderful our stay was at Fireside Motel. The view was phenomenal, the staff amazing and the rooms were very large and accommodating. Without a doubt, we will be back when we travel the Coast again.
reviews.title: Simply amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Ocean views were excellent!! Staff was very accommodating when we wanted to stay another day. However, wi-fi did not work in our bottom south-end unit. We will definitely stay there on our next visit to the Oregon coast!
reviews.title: This is the place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second stay here. The first time we "tripped" upon it while it was pouring down rain late one night. We were pleasantly surprised with the rate, how friendly the staff was and the room with a deck facing the ocean. Spacious room with a king size bed and the bathroom was very nice. We loved the deck outside our room where we could sit and watch the surf crashing on the rocks approximately 100 ft away! Quiet, clean and comfortable with a nice continental breakfast in the lobby. Love this place!!
reviews.title: Don't pass this place by!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife & I stayed 3 Days at the Fireside this week and everything was great!! My wife got a massage at the Overleaf Lodge & Spa next door & the staff there was so nice as well. Thanks to you all for making this visit so nice. We will see you all in August.
reviews.title: Thank you Fireside Motel & staff for making our stay wonderfull.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed overnight at this property after checking out the reviews.
reviews.title: How to assess a 'no star' motel?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had an upstairs ocean view room but as this was not an 'ocean front' room there was no sound of the sea. The room itself was excellent, carpet appeared new, 2 comfortable armchairs and a comfortable bed.Linens and towels were moderate. There is no air con here, relying on fresh air but as the window opens only about 1 cm there is not a lot of that. They said something about a vent above the door but this was not evident.
reviews.title: Awesome Affordable Lodging

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was very basic and as has been reported has to be taken back to the room. As I had not been expecting any breakfast this was not a deal breaker.
reviews.title: Fab location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Internet connection only worked very early in the morning - guess less folk were trying to use it at that hour.
reviews.title: Amazing little motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: for the comfortable room alone I would return but not in high summer.
reviews.title: Magical!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: I bring my mother to the Fireside, along with her little dog, regularly because it is such a lovely break from our home routine. The walking path along the bluff is accessible for her walker, and she delights at being to walk along and enjoy the waves and fresh, salt air. It is such a pet-friendly place that caring for the dog's needs is easy, and even though he is just as elderly as my mother, he really perks up on the walks where so many other dogs have enjoyed the path without leaving a sign for people to notice. The staff is cordial and efficient. I have never had an interaction with any of them, from the office staff to those who clean the rooms, that wasn't cheerful and welcoming. It's a lovely place to relax!
reviews.title: Respite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Memorial Day weekend ! Found a great place to stay on the Oregon Coast ! Clean rooms, smelled great, good gift shop, nice and accommodating - desk team had our paperwork and keys ready even at 10:30 pm ! The inn is right on the beach and what a scene, beautiful and the place was so quiet - the inn was full !! We would certainly stay here again - and with all this it was also pet friendly !! Snaps and Claps for the Fireside !
reviews.title: A Short Stop with a nice surprise !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed three nights in room 40 - an end room directly overlooking the ocean, on the 2nd floor. The room was very generously sized, with king bed, sofa, high style table with two comfortable bar stool height chairs. We managed to bring an amazing amount of "stuff" with us on this trip - since weather was uncertain we had both seriously over-packed. The room was so large, however, that we did not feel cramped at all.
reviews.title: A really lovely place to stay in Yachats!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The view of the tide coming in, and after the first day, the waves crashing during a spring storm, was breathtaking - i have a TON of video, as I was just captivated by the view.
reviews.title: A delightful day on the Oregon Coast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Breakfast was pretty limited. However, as I'm an early riser and my partner is not, I appreciated the availability of scones/muffins and fruit to tide me over. Then our "real" breakfast/early lunch at the Green Salmon Coffee House in town could kick in!
reviews.title: A Good Moderately Priced Place to Stay and Enjoy the Oregon Coast

description: Relax, refresh and rejuvenate at the Fireside Motel on the oceanfront. Most of the rooms have breathtaking oceanfront views and are amazingly close to the surf pounding on the rocky coastline. Tide pools abound with life in the surf in front of your room and a well maintained State Park trail meanders along the bluff and ends at a nearby sandy beach. Many of our rooms are pet friendly, so bring your favorite pet(s) too!
